ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: We will only postpone it until a predetermined time.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: We are deferring it only for a time ordained.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Nor shall We withhold it except till an appointed term.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: during a single day. We have deferred this day for an appointed time.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And We do not postpone it except for a fixed term.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And We delay it only for a term (already) fixed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And We do not delay it but to an appointed term.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and We shall not postpone it, save to a term reckoned;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And We defer it only to a term already reckoned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: We will only postpone it until a predetermined time,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And We defer it not but to a term determined.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And We do not defer it but for a determinate term.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Nor shall We delay it but for a term appointed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And We delay it only for a term (already) fixed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: We shall not postpone it except until a counted term.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: We only postpone it until a predetermined time.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And We do not delay it except for a limited term.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [11:104] And We do not defer it but to a term [already] reckoned, [but] to a time predetermined by God.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And We defer it) i.e. that day (only as a term already reckoned) only to an appointed time.
